fields.headline: Need to know
fields.bodyText: War digest day 18: 06.04.03 · British forces found boxes with hundreds of human remains in a warehouse in southern Iraq. · Iraqis must 'rattle their (the allies) joints and terrify them', Saddam announced on state TV. · US troops fought with paramilitaries in Kerbala in a bid to protect the backs of American forces moving into Baghdad. · Two US Marine pilots died when their Cobra helicopter crashed. · US Marines dug up a suspected chemical weapons hiding place at a girls' school south of Baghdad. · Kurdish forces have started massing troops near the oil-rich city of Khanaqin. · Black-clad members of Saddam's Fedayeen militia appeared on the capital's streets for the first time in the war. · Two-thirds of the public approve of Tony Blair's handling of the war, according to a YouGov poll. Casualty count Britain 27 troops killed - 22 of them in friendly fire incidents or by accident. United States 62 troops killed in hostile action. 13 killed in friendly fire or by accident. Eight missing. Iraq Soldiers killed in the battle for Baghdad 320; 500 civilians dead, 5,000 wounded. Journalists Four killed, two missing.
